one_reviews_text: After finishing all the chapters and unlocking all weapons I can safely say that this game was kinda bad. Not enough freedom of choice

I think the combat update was fine but when you stick a knife in a zombies head it has a timer then you can pull it out not like in S&S where you have to yank it out. I liked the old version better. Fix please

With the recent update on the game, I’d say it is a good game nowadays. It’s not like saints and sinners, kind of reminds me of Arizona Sunshine but better. I like the game and the story, it’s fun and I’m glad that ranged weapons are useful now and they’ve balanced it out more. They even used Eugene’s actual voice for it.

Playing the game is fun but it gets boring quick, I like playing as Daryl and the characters from twd, but the mechanics of the game are not good compared to saints and sinners, the only fun thing about this game is the story but you rarely even do story.

First, the melee combat definitely takes a little time to get used to. I've almost completed all of the campaign chapters and I've been having a lot of fun with it. The story itself is interesting and more so if you're a fan of the series. Don't get me wrong, it's far from Saints and Sinners in overall quality, but as long as you don't go into it expecting a similar experience to S&S you should have a decent time with it.

Three things absolutely RUINED this game for me:

1. The constant red fog that pushes you along in a certain direction that will kill you if you remain in it for too long, which discourages exploration and keeps you rushing. 

2. On-screen prompts warning you not to go a certain way. 
3. The fact that you must keep replaying the same scavaging levels over and over in order to upgrade and unlock story levels. 

Other aspects of this game that are not good are the washed out brown low-res graphics, constantly running out of ammo and being forced to use knives, limited interaction, and the gameplay seeming to get more dull the more you play. Didn't really enjoy my time spent with this game.

review_title: Nothing in this game is done well
one_reviews_text: The whole game is just mediocre ideas, bad excecution.  The combat isn't challenging in any way, the only thing that makes combat even remotely difficult is how bad it is. Making it take two or three shots in the head to kill a zombie instead of just making it hard to actually shoot them. Or when you stab one in the head you then have to stand there for a full two seconds before you can do anything else. The hoard is just red fog with 2D zombie textures on it.

There was a huge mistake taking out the idea of multiplayer since there is 3 characters you can choose from have a maximum of three people to all play together would love to see it also my friends would be able to play with me so take this into consideration and if you want higher ratings and more cash that's the way to go!
insane

This was a fun adventure in the world of TWD. The gameplay is quite stimulating, and the encounters with the walkers are really good.It's quite immersive to make your way through them and watch your back constantly while you're out scavenging food and medicine.Make sure you always have an emergency exit when you go indoors because using a firearm does attract nearby walkers.I only took one star because the motion system is a bit clunky (even teleport) and sometimes punching a walker in the face when your knife is stuck in their skull doesn't really work.
I'm fan of walking dead. There are many bad review. Once you follow the story and do the scavange mission. You will feel like the world of walking dead.

I love the walking dead tv show and playing this in VR was great. They do have a bit too many zombies and thinking which made me a bit disappointed just because there normally wouldn’t be that many unless you start making loud sounds. But I do get that it’s the challenge for that game. The features/things that you can do are limited to what I was expecting. Killing the walkers is the fun part for me. You do play as the characters in the walking dead like Rick. I enjoy playing the game but I did want a bit more free roaming to be in it.

Really good gameplay and graphics, I think it unfairly receives criticism because people expected to play another version of saints and sinners but it’s not so people thought bad of it from the start. It runs easily on my pc which has an rx 590 so it’s not the highest of specs which is strange because when playing saints and sinners the FPS is always dropping and locking at 45 but this is as smooth as butter.

review_title: 3 and a half stars for me
one_reviews_text: I looooove the tv show, and when I saw this I new that I was going to preorder pronto. you have some of the voice actors from the show like Josh Mcdermit (Eugene) and Norman Reedus (Daryl, Of course) the gameplay aspect needs work like walkers should go down with one shot not 2 or 3. and i notice the walkers latch on to me from 2 feet away, i still manage to kill them but yeah. the modded weapons should have a visual look to them. overall i like the game just needs some improvement. Mabye a graphics update

Story is good enought but easy to finish the whole game - you only need a freaking knife!
I wonder why developers don't allow some basic stuff like handle two weapons -one on each hand of course- at once as OLDER games allows?
Do they got a XXI century idea with XX century developers?

review_title: Should not have been a VR Title
one_reviews_text:
I have a video review of this game

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zi0tNXlbMKU

PROS:
Decent shooter 
Stab zombies

CONS:
bad Vr implementation
No interaction with objects
Knives are god like weapons while guns take multiple shots
Alexandria - basically a paint on job - no interaction

im only giving this 1 star becuase theres a ton of issues and dump mechanics

-Walkers should die with ONE shot to the head, not 4 mags.
-The Running Speed is too slow i feel like im moving slower then the walkers.
-Ammo is not enough especially with the 3 round burst glock
-all four characters dont have their signature weapons and magically find their way into a big military crate.
-One of the devs said that guns are supposed to be as realistic to the walking dead show but thats a lie. if you shoot someone in the head in real life they instantly die. maybe walkers have rotten bullet proof skulls?
-The Machete cant kill the walkers with riot helmets, i cant stab them from the chin and up but it only goes through their neck.
-The starting pistol doesnt do anything and it doesnt feel like im shooting a real gun, it feels like im shooting a nerf gun with recoil.
-The 1911 45acp was better then the M9 but it seems less 45 cal but more 0.1 cal
-There should be a mode for practice shooting all of the weapons in the game 
-The game feels half assed and rushed because there is no healing like saints and sinners and hell the weapons took a walker out with one shot and those guns arnt as good looking and correct sizes as the ones in this game. i also feel like guns are completely useless and the machete and butcher knife or cleaver  and the hatchet are the only weapons that work.
-Blunted weapons like hammers and wrenches and tools dont do anything to walkers besides make them take 2 steps back.

Clearly this game isnt ready to be a full release so make it early access and make major updates every single month along with dlc and give the exclusive content for free because this game shouldnt be worth more then $10. Walking Dead Saints & Sinners VR is decades ahead of this game. I know the game just came out yesterday (its 1:04 AM 09/30/2020 for me rn) but seriously this shouldnt be called a walking dead game if it feels like arcade shooters like arizona sunshine.

review_title: It's just really not that good
one_reviews_text:
Onslaught, unlike S&S is not one of the all time greats. Onslaught is actually pretty bad and I DO NOT recommend that you buy it. But for some reason I still kinda find it fun to play. Weird. 

I realise that Onslaught is going for more of an arcade vibe, and that's fine by me because that's my preferred style, but it literally does nothing well. The story isn’t great, the voice acting is only ok and the lack of interactions would make a 2016 VR game blush in embarrasment. The music and graphics are servicable at best, but all of that could probably been ignored if it wasn't for a few things...

WHY CAN I NOT USE MY LEFT HAND TO HOLD A F*%KING WEAPON?!?! I really, really don't understand why they didn't allow you to dual wield. A knife in one hand and a gun in the other and the game would be 1000 times better with just that improvement alone.

WHY IS THE HERD A RED FOG AND NOT AN ACTUAL HERD OF F*%KING ZOMBIES?!?! Honestly, I really enjoy the way the ever encroaching horde forces you to play quickly through the scavenger missions. If the threat of imminant death was an actual herd that you had no chance of beating, but could at least go down swinging then again, these levels would have actually been really cool.

WHY DON'T HEADSHOTS F*%KING KILL THE ZOMBIES?!?! There is absolutely no benefit to using the guns in this game at all. You are much better to just wander around with the starting knife, with your arm stretched out and just stroll into the walkers whose heads seem to offer the same resistance as a block of half melted butter.

EDIT: The update has really improved the game. I still think it’s a 3 star (3.5 maybe) game, but for some reason I can’t stop playing it. I’ve actually played it twice as long as I did S&S now, and I don’t know why.

I'm only a couple of levels in but so far it's decent.  

I REALLY wish they had gotten all the real actors to voice their characters in game.  This would have bumped it up a notch for me.

Walkers need to die with with one gunshot to the head, just like in the show.

Controls seem a bit off but once you get used to them they are fine. Whats wierd is grabbing weapons with your left hand but they appear in your right hand breaking immersion.

I hope the devs keep on updating this game and maybe some DLC?  Negan maybe?

review_title: A bit of a u finished game not great !!
one_reviews_text:
Update I have finished the game 5 Oct 2020 

And very disappointed 
1 it was very quick to finish 
2 TWD S&S 100 time better more story
3 used a knife all way thro only used guns on last level 
4 killing zombies was rubbish and same same after a while 
5 made u grind to get more levels
6 not worth money 

Loved Saints and sinners this takes it one step further By playing with TWD characters only done first 2 levels but very happy so far 

I pre ordered and still haven’t go my founders gold sword or knife maybe need to level up more  

It’s a shame they didn’t use all real actors voices but it would have pushed game price up I guess 

I will return after I’ve got my teeth into it and write more

Ps the same is so much less glitchy than TWD S&S when In combat so bonus

In nearly all aspects, Saints and Sinners is the better game.  If you want to play a game where the graphics are top notch and the physics are realistic, buy Saints and Sinners.  Onslaught is literally half the game Saints is.

Killing zombies in Onslaught isn't realistic at all.  Saints is able to make you feel as if you are actually battling zombies with the haptics they applied.  Onslaught barely has any true physical feel of combat.

This begs to question why the same engine was not used to build Onslaught.  They had the programming down in Saints.  Why not port the quality of Saints over to Onslaught with a unique storyline.

Onslaught is a total disappointment when compared to Saints.  I was expecting the same quality.

As others have said it’s not saints and sinners that’s for sure..the weapons don’t have any weight to them what so ever...the graphics really need updating 
It takes 3 shots to the head to kill walkers..

I just hope the devs will update with patches..it could end up being a good game

After playing through Saints and Sinners three times and loving every one, I was so looking forward to Onslaught. I was very disapointed. 

The user interface was not well made for VR, its not intuitive and down right awkward. Why make the characters with holsters if you can't use it? Why do you have to grab everything with the left hand even though it holds weapons with the right hand? 

Oh and the environment looks like it was the same graphic technology as Skyrim from a decade ago, in fact, I don't think the envrionment was as good as the VR version of Skyrim. 

The rolling horde wall was a cheap way to dodge making real game play. 

The story line, character development and narratives were pretty bad too. This game had no suspension of disbelief, there was just too many obstacles to buy into the story.

I love a good VR game, and I'm so disapointed that this game wasn't one because I loved Saints and Sinners. I would ask for a refund but I'm hoping they push updates that fixes some of this stuff.

DONT ASSUME UR GONNA PLAY A SAINTS AND SINNERS LOOKALIKE!!

(i pre-ordered my game but still dont have my weapons)
This game is great ..sometimes

It has some flaws like the faces , they look like a todler has draw it on them.
Then the voice acting. Hiring the real actors would be to expensive , but.... now sometimes its sounds really boring.
But thats all the negative things i have to say.

The game itself is really beautifull , top graphics , slicing up a zombie with ur knife feels really satisfying! 
Ppl complaining about the knife is "overpowered"? 
Some other ppl will really like that , i do use the knife to cut everyone i encounter.
Im only been in Main Street for supplies but this game has it.
Dont get fooled by those negative reviews bcs in my opinion ..... 70% of them are fake.
It has been a long time since Oculus put such a good game in store again and it was about time.
Recommended? 101% yes!

Update : always doing the same scavenger hunt over and over  is boring


Update Update 3/10 : the longer i play the more i notice the devs need some more work on this one , its getting boring , why do we need to search all over the same place so many times? after 4 times scavenging main street ill quit. Only Daryll story's are somehow still intressting.gonna try the new 10$ weapons update.

The other reviews of this game are fairly accurate.  I bought this game expecting another Walking Dead Saints & Sinners, but I was very mistaken.  It was nice being able to alter and base/weapons a little bit, but other than that, it was depressing.  The combat was overly simplified and not exciting at all.  The scavenging missions were basically timed and increasing the difficulty basically only speeds up the time frame you have to gather supplies.  

Overall, it was a let down of a game and I would have not gotten it if I knew it wasn't going to be another Walking Dead Saints & Sinners.

I have a hard time imagining hardcore TWD fans not liking this game. The voice actors are great, Rick's voice actor in particular is a great laugh, I can't decide yet if he's imitating Andrew Lincoln or Keanu Reeves. And then having some of our favorite characters voiced by the actors themselves is a treat. Arizona Sunshine, though it goes on sale for cheaper, is still the more expensive game, and Onslaught is miles ahead of that game. Negative reviews are misguided.

Update: After reading many reviews some things need addressed.

Guns can be upgraded people, please stop complaining that the lowest level un-upgraded weapon is not powerful enough. Have you ever played an arcade style game? ever?

And please please stop comparing this to other games like S&S, Half-life and Boneworks. I'm sorry that you can't pick up useless items and play with them, but some of us don't care if you can carry a toy monkey around for no apparent reason. If you want to compare it to another game, try Arizona Sunshine which is nowhere near as good as this game.

The game is actually very well put together. I think everyone is judging this game while basing it on another. This game is amazing! I’ve played everything worth playing on both rift and quest ; this game makes you feel unstoppable! It feels exactly like what we see when we watch the show.. and be honest aside from the great story line.. we really are glued during the action scenes. They nailed it! It is exactly like watching the show! Great campaign! Game is worth the money we paid in my opinion it’s worth more. Anyone complaining about this game is close minded.
I’ve read some pretty bad reviews for this but I am just having a blast with it!

I bought this, thinking it would have some sense of survival to it. IT DOES NOT! it's basically a zombie time trial, where you maneuver through linear maps, just trying to pick up "supplies", before some fortnite red gas cloud touches you. This game feels more pathetic than mobile games. PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY FOR SOMETHING BETTER

......it could  be much better. If they would have put a bit more effort in it, it could be more fun to play it longer than 5-7 hours. 
It's not the game I expected after the advertisement. You don't get any open world feeling and in the end it's only beating up some zombies with melee weapons (because when you use firearms you'll don't have any chance)  So I'm really dissapointet about that game.

-Ok, the Campaign is  nice so far, but only 7 chapters??? ... even the story has no end...
-Very few "scavenging-missions", looking nearly the same each.  
-Building up Alexandria is ridiculous and youre not able to walk around. 
-Modifiing weapons could be also done better. 
-The different characters don't have any special abilitys.
-Side-storys only via letters on the board? (Hey where ar all the people in town to talk about it?)
....these are the most annoying points.

Gameplay and graphics are mostly individual points of view so I'wont write about it.
At least it's a 15$ worth game .... not more .... not really....

It's okay, but not realistic enough... Saints and Sinners is WAYYY better. I feel like im playing an alpha, and why are they dying with 3 headshots, like what... That's so stupid. Nope, run me my refund !

This game was obviously rushed out the door. I dont know if COVID-19 played a part in the fact this game is REALLY unpolished but never the less it is. The controls are not good. They feel clunky and janky as hell. How is this possible when Saints and Sinners already had code that was lightyears ahead of this. This honestly felt like playing a VR game from VR's early days. The graphics are uninpressive. I think when creators make games that can be run on the Quest alone they have to dial them back so much that Rift S users like me who are connecting their headset to a $5,000 PC with a 2080 Ti just will not enjoy it. It looks like Skyrim or Fallout 3 era graphics. But the graphics I can ignore if the gameplay is solid......too bad for us it's not. The weapons have no weight, swinging a huge heavy wrench in this game is exactly like flailing your sword around in Skyrim, it feels horrible. You cant interact with about 99% of the set pieces and surroundings. You cant really explore anywhere off the very linear line. You cant explore and interact with your base. This game feels like its literally half baked. I dont even think patches can save it. I plan on returning it, its that bad. What a huge disappointment.

review_title: It has issues, but for 30$ I enjoyed it
one_reviews_text:
If the game would have price 50 or 60$ I would give it 3 stars. For 30$ it's pretty ok for me.

Pros:
- I like graphics more than Saints and Sinners - I hate "cartoon style" graphics
- Models of zombies and their deads are very nice
- UI of game is well done
- Game keeps you under "stress"
- Zombie models does not feel repetetive that much as in other games (for example in Arizona sunshine, you see "same" zombies everywhere.
- You have your favourite characters from AMC series
- Armored zombies are pretty cool

Cons:
- Shooting weapons does not kill zombies on headshot. You have to repeat headshot many times. What the hell man.... even strongest gun does not. Only one shooting weapon which kills with headshot is crossbow...
- Basically all scavenging levels does have same map scheme. You play new mission in new sector, but you think "hey, I know this backyard" and you actually do. Even different missions has very same maps.
- I'm not satisfied with how slashing weapons work. Firearm axe is much better than katana. Hell, why? Machette useless. Boxing knife is worse than army knife due that you can not change how your character hold it. etc.
- Story is not that good as I expected and it has opened ending...
- It's much more arcade game than survivor
- Even hardest difficulty is pretty easy. I finished in on hard and I died just 2 times. And it wasn't even in the (hardest) game ending. Hardest difficulty should be at least "hard but playable" but not that easy.

This game is also absolutely epic. PLEASE, don’t base your judgement off the bad reviews, especially if you’re a zombie or TWD show fan. 

However, this game is not perfect. One thing I need added is a smooth turning speed adjustment. Right now it is just too slow to turn, but definitely workable when combined with real turning. I hope they add coop! It would be really fun scavenging with friends and sharing the supplies. Also, walking around more of Alexandria and interacting with the buildings we make would be awesome. I also wish more of the environment was physics based like all of HL:A, but it doesn’t really make a difference in the actual gameplay, so I understand why it could be left out. 

The melee and gun mechanics combined make this the best VR zombie game, possibly best zombie game ever considering the actual interaction with zombies. In this game, walkers don’t really die until you puncture their skull a few inches into the brain. This means they will keep coming until you kill them properly, which is just like the show and is super cool. Next, you can shrug them off just by moving your hands into them or holding a button for a harder punch. If you slice at their arms, they will come off with awesome detail. If you repeatedly stab their chest, mouth, or anywhere really, a detailed hole will form. The weapons aren’t made to weigh like real life, so it feels more like Arizona Sunshine and that is much preferred when fighting off massive hordes. You can switch from melee to guns instantly with 4 weapons to choose from at a time, and a ton of options in total. The hardest difficulty feels like Resident Evil games where the zombies don’t die in one headshot. At first I didn’t like it, but when I realized this was the same strategy as RE, it made sense, especially when you get a lot more powerful guns than just a pistol. 

The lack of artificial stamina is amazing. Instead, you get 4 times the zombies than S&S, and get tired just from the epic hordes. Weapons don’t break, so that’s not a useless, unrealistic worry. The gun physics are not hyper realistic, but they are close enough and actually simplify it while keeping enough of the interaction to make it a perfect blend of fun and realistic. The gun range is really fun and works great as a practice/prep zone. 

I think the graphics are really nice, especially the zombies. There are a ton of different types and they are all super detailed. The environment is really nice also. Not to mention, the STORY is great! This picks off from the show right after they defeat The Saviors, which means new interactive content for a great show. The way they tie into the story as rebuilding Alexandria like a State of Decay type base building game and then also get a personal Daryl story is awesome as a TWD fan. 

I highly recommend this game, it’s incredibly fun and mind blowing as a long time zombie gamer.

-Zompacalypse Gaming

review_title: So much promise and great art direction
one_reviews_text:
Well, I've finished the game on veteran and upgraded every weapon to the max. It's pretty satisfying to chop up zombies with a katana or a battle axe, and the guns feel nice (only when fully upgraded).

Shamefully, the only replayability now is to run through a scavenging mission...it really needs a horde mode. Story is okay.

After playing TWD Saints & Sinners, my excitement for this was high! I was not impressed with Onslaught. The graphics are ok, the storyline is pretty dull, and You can't interact with your environment. Such as opening a fridge, picking up items on a counter etc. The evac missions to earn supplies and civilians are pretty cool. I am not a fan of the physics in this game. The zombies feel really lite and flimsey. Like when you slap one in the face they kinda just spaz around in an unrealistic way. TWD Saints and Sinners did a great job giving the Zombies weight and making weapons and people feel heavy. THIS GAME NEEDS MAJOR WORK!!

what is the point of a vr game where your hands mean nothing?

pressing a button and having items magically appear in THE OPPOSITE HAND is a complete joke ( i actually laughed in dissapointment and amazment the first time i picked something up because of how rediculous these hand mechanics actually are )

There is also almost no concept of wieght in this game. you can grab a 3-4 ft long pipe wrench and swing it around like you have nothing in your hand, then on top of this you can play golf with dead zombies and yeet them as far as you want on the ground but things like water bottles and plates and other objects in the world are just painted on basically, you cannot interact with anything in the enviroment unless its specifically for the story. 

Graphics are also a complete dissapointment, Compared to what we you would expect from a game immitating a show.
Take Normal Reedus for example, look at death stranding norman reedus (on ps4 not PC) then have a look at darryl in this game.  
see what i mean?

highly dissapointed in this game, if you buy it remember the refund policy is 2 hours game play and within 14 days from purchase

I am stuck in the tutorial.  The hammer will not bash the lock, despite trying many times, from different angles, with different buttons pushed.  Is there a trick to this?  Or is there a bug?  If I cannot get past this soon -- with some help -- I have tried what I can, I will request a refund.
it could be good but its not the story is bad the control are horrible unless you love the tv show not worth it. saints and sinners is amazing if you want to kill zombies, go get that

People are expecting this game to be something it isn't.. There is no stamina and the mele combat is op and you're also able to pick stuff up fast, but people don't understand that it's intentionall... It's a fast paced game and you're supposed to grab a lot of loot as fast as possible and get back to base while you're being chased by a horde while finding new weapons etc.

 People are complaining about pistols taking 3 shots to the head, still that's intentionall... If you had a pistol that could one shot all the walkers in the start what would be the point, the point of this game is to find loot and upgrade your base and your weapons lol not have one shot item at the start, so you actually have to rely more on mele, at the start which i enjoyed at least.

The story missions are great as you follow daryl after he got lost and there is no timer and you can explore the lore and everything else at your own paste. I actually really enjoyed it and i really do think you should buy it, i gaurante it gets more fun as the game goes on!

I actually recommend despite all these negative reviews!

I was expecting another saints and sinners, what I got instead was a glitch fest. 

The main action is scavenging random crap on runs. It’s just not that fun, the walker glitch constantly. The guns are not one shot to the head instant kill. But the knives are. 

It’s still fun but it definitely let me down.
I didn't love saints and sinners but this game is amazing. I love how you get to play as the original characters, also the combat is good but needs a little improvement.

Right off the bat... listening to yourself as some B rate Rick chastizing a Norman who we know, obviously can handle himself... the whole dialogue was just really hard to listen to... and just difficult to relate with the characters and get immersed.  Then I was trying to get into the swing of things at the camp/hub... and when I started my first mission I was hyping myself up... and that lasted all of three minutes.  This red mist started forcing me along as I was exploring and trying to immerse myself in the environment.  Im being told its full of zombies... well let me the hell at em!  Ive been running the streets all over zombie riddled new orleans, and want to get my hands dirty!  Please try and improve the interface with my weapons and the zombies, its sort of like their heads suck your blade in.  Oh and maybe keep me from dying to something I dont get a chance to actually fight, and I will come back and play.  I just cant get caught off to the side getting some loot by a red gas, and not be give a chance to prove my zombie dominating skills.  I wanted to like it... but it needs some more love behind the scenes.

This game is nothing like saints and sinners.  It only packs a 5 hour gameplay if you rush through it. zombies should die with one shot to the head and knives and melee weapons should get stuck inside the zombies head
  You cant explore your own base.  You just do missions and get back.  It is fun dont get me wrong the lever actions are really fun to use and it did scare my family members alot.  But its not worthy of a $30 PRICE TAG ITS its more of a $20.  
If they add more missions and missions you can ectually explore instead of being timed like saints and sinners i would love this game even more and diffenitly change my review.  Also the picking up items is very unrelastic you point and grab and the items disapear and end up at your base

Its pretty good! Not 100% with controls and some weapons but i really like it! I would make it that if you could grab objects with your grip button and hold it in, and if you let go then you drop it like any other game, but i really enjoy it!

Game adaptations of AMC's The Walking Dead seem to have trouble trying to match the series' tone. Oppose to games set within the comic book's world, the TV show's adaptations have narrative dissonance through gameplay. The series is all about survival and exploring the worse of humanity when they're pushed into a corner. In TWD: Onslaught, it's as if someone absorbed the basics of the series through pop culture osmosis and made a game around it. The narrative is incredivly light as the focus is on the action. The latter of which is more so that this can easily be without the TWD license and I wouldn't compare it to the franchise.

There is no greater sense of danger or tension as your knife can one-hit kill zombies faster than headshots with a pistol. There is no stamina meter, no weapon degration, and while there is limited ammo, running around stabbing the infected with a knife just feels like I could single-handedly stop the apocalypse.

There is a gamey element of unlocking stronger perks as you gather materials to upgrade your settlement. It's the game's way of "leveling up" along with finding new weapons. However thanks to the rise of other games that offer more interactivity (see: Half-Life Alyx and TWD Saints & Sinners) with picking up items, you point to the item and it automatically moves into your inventory.

The arcadey element is an okay gameplay feature, but if you're a TWD fan expecting a great narrative and invigorating gameplay, look somewhere else. If you just want to shoot zombies in arcadey environments with some "gamey" features, there are slightly better games out there for you.

I saw this game and I thought "oh wow another walking dead game, it looks like it will be more open world and I will have access to more weapons to kill the zombies with!", but when I loaded the game I was instantly disappointed by the tutorial level. The weapons are stuck to your hand and there is a weapon wheel instead of a realistic weapon storage system. The game reloads for you and you don't even feel like you are doing anything. The looting system just requires you to point your hand at an item and it flies to you. Weapons have no weight to them at all which takes you out of the immersion. If you are looking for a good, immersive walking dead experience, purchase saints and sinners.
Ive played TWD S&S and loved it and this gave me the same vibes cant wait to go back into vr and keep killing those walkers

Very disappointed with this game. They could have really built off of Saints and Sinners mechanics instead they decided to go a totally different route. It feels more like a cheap TV show promo game as opposed to a real VR experience. The price is way too much for the content and quality it delivers.

Going into this game I was expecting it be a really well maintained and good looking game with good exploration aspects but boy was i wrong. This could only pass as a mobile game or something but as an oculus game for £30, this is a absolute rip-off. The only good thing about it is how the voice actors sound similar/ are the ones from the show.

If you were a fan of Saints and Sinners, go back and play that. This game’s awful collision detection, awkward, floppy combat, and unchangeable control interface make for a clunky and unpleasant experience. It’s a shame because I feel like the mechanics are interesting but that is all eclipsed by just how bad the VR and emersion is. Guns feel weak and clunky (and mechanically bare little resemblance to their real-world counterparts), melee weapons range from wildly uncontrollable to only usable in one motion, and over-all killing zombies just isn’t fun. If you want to grab a zombie with your left hand and gently tap it on the forehead over and over then you might be able to forgive the combat for what seems like a cool upgrade mechanic but with a Walking Dead game already on the market that is superior in every way I don’t really see why this game needs to exist.

review_title: Big fan... not crazy about game
one_reviews_text:
I don't write these often so I'll be brief, 
For starters a head shot should be instant for  weapons like blades, guns, and heavy enough melee (ie. The extra large wrench at the start).
The picking up of items is a little awkward but manageable.
The hoard wave should be a little more realistic, to explain, it seems wrong that you would lose health being close to the herd without actually being hit by the walkers. The red field effect is ok for reference, but it shouldn't hurt you through a wall or building when the walkers aren't even in line of site to you.  Not to mention that you start with the herd already close to you, practically forcing you to skip anything at the very start of the mission just so you have time to stay ahead of them.  
Maybe its just my experience with the game so far so I would leave it to your own judgment. 
At least the weapons don't break after one or a few uses...

review_title: I wish I could give a proper review.
one_reviews_text: Started a game, tried to finish tutorial - VR blackscreened after few minutes (Never happened before). Tried again, went abit further into the tutorial - blackscreened again. By the looks of other comments / reviews seems like Im not losing much aside from couple of minutes in tutorial. Very dissapointed + refund incoming.

game runs fine for the most part but if you compare this almost feels like you guys were just hoping to get people who enjoyed walking dead saints and sinners which was a great game but this one almost feels like the devs were just told quickly make a game so we can get more money. instead of an enjoyable well made game instead its a cash grab using the characters from the show
... compared to Saints & Sinners
I loved saints and sinners and this is just as good if not better

review_title: This game sucks but has good combat.
one_reviews_text: The ending was garbage because you DONT EVEN FIND DAISY!!! Why? These developers were soooo lazy. The combat is so satisfying and fun but the story was crap. Play saints and sinners if you enjoy story and a challenge.

review_title: Poor graphic quality and limited actions
one_reviews_text: Considering I have played the Walking Dead: Saint and Sinners and Half Life: Alyx, the graphic of this one is lacking details. Also, the action mechanism is very limited, the trigger buttons are only used for selecting object and the grip buttons are only to pick up items. You don't even need to grip onto the weapons nor doing any motions for storing items in hands into backpack. The walkers are a bit of a joke as they are weaker against melee than firearms. You need like 2-3 headshots with firearms while just 1 stab in the head. I think this has great potential of community and story building, just need more patches and upgrades.
This game is a major disappointment. If you want a good walking dead game play saints and sinners.

I,ve played past the refund time so I may as well save someone wasted cash other than myself for all the negative reasons stated in other negative reviews ,this games not worth my time to insult , poor effort sevious
It's not as refined as saints and sinners to me, but great vr shooter.
It's fun with fluid on the attacking zombies and grabbing the items and different concept on the zombie game then saint and sinners and more on the story of the walking dead series.
Complete fail! I dont need to repeat the bad reviews!

-Walkers should die with one shot to the head, not THREE.
-Lighting is very dull
-Walkers dont really feel like a threat considering how easy it is to kill everything in sight with the starting knife. Kinda renders all firearms useless.
I think if they put out some quality updates/patches out, they have the potential to make the game A LOT better.
Very yes. Feels just awesome to play. 100% must have
I pre ordered this game only for the Co-op and they removed it, now its like a bad saints and sinners
the game is good if u like arcady type of games and i love the game all the weapons are fun and i think it is forth 20 pounds
This game is awesome but the multiplayer with crossplay is missing if this get into the game it will be the best game i ever played!
a nice game with a good story line
Very interesting
To be honest, after playing saints and sinners this game is lame.

With a few patches this game could be way better. So after playing the downsides are the voice acting isn't done by the OG actors/actresses, and the tracking in combat seems a little off for their hitboxes, and I am a left handed player, and while playing Saints and Sinners, i throughly enjoyed being able to move with my left hand, and currently i dont see an option where players can switch that preference. Stopped playing as the mobility issue was a bit too annoying for me to handle (for now). But willing to change review if a patch comes along to address this. 
p.s please give headshots the ability to be a one shot kill, 3 in the head seems excessive.

It really makes fun to relive the story of The Walking Dead.. but the game is not ready for release.. it has many bugs and only a small selection of missions.. and these missions even are on a very small map, wich isn't even open world just survival. Please rerelease or update the game!

review_title: Would be better with more time
one_reviews_text:
If this game had a patch for a more realistic feel such as the gun taking three shots to kill 1 walker. It should only take one. If you want to play a real walking dead game, go play Saints and Sinners. It is more worth your money than this is. If they fixed a lot of stuff, I give it a higher review. Kind of dissappointed.

Edit: not trying to push it but arizona sunshine would be better than this game if it had melee combat

review_title: Sadly not a patch on Saints & Sinners
one_reviews_text:
My Initial Impressions:
Sadly not a patch on Saints & Sinners, and Survios is one of my favourite VR developers.
The game looks like Arizona Sunshine from 2 years ago and plays more like an arcade game.
I do enjoy this style of VR game and I approached this video as someone who was new to VR.  I think those types of people will like it, but I can see why there is so much negativity from the stable VR community.

Impressions Video // Oculus Rift S // RTX 2070 Super:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=weZQxdBZmSg

With an awful launch experience (pre-orders not being able to install) and many early negative reviews my expectations for the game was low but I thought I would give it a go. I am a TWD fan and I really like Saints and Sinners, and still I am enjoying this game. I am about 3 hours of gameplay in so probably about halfway through it. Firstly, it's an arcade game, not what we are used to in recent VR games, so it does feel a step back compared to other new games. The story is ok, it is a bit like an episode of TWD that you get to take part in. The crafting part is woven into the story mode in a way to extend the gameplay (and games length). It is too easy, but I have played worst games. However, with it being set in the Walking Dead universe with familiar characters and setting I think it's worth a play.

I love this game so much but you need to fix the 3 shot to the head it should be one shot its really annoying and please make this game multiplayer for scavenge PLEASE it will make the game 10 times more fun but the campaign is really good, and one more thing PLEASE can you fix the audio because it sounds really quiet sometimes its on full blast and still it sounds quiet thank you!!!

The running is messed up, makes the game somewhat unenjoyable, please fix the running and make speed settings for smooth turn please! It is way to slow. But amazing game nontheless. Amazing work yall!

review_title: Last time i pre order a game.
one_reviews_text: run through badly designed levels grabbing anything that glows. a slow red mist closes in and when youre in starts to take your health hoping to get to the van at the end, thats the game. no exploration. buy saints and sinners instead.

I love Saints and Sinners, the feeling to melee a walker is so fun. The less fun is weapons breaking and a day/night cycle.

Here I was hoping for this game to have none of that and so far it doesn't. I only tried the intro, 1 savenging mission, and was doing Daryl's story mission. There is one HUGE reason I got fed up and had to stop playing and hope this gets patched.

Grabbing walkers is not working as indended. I sure wish it is easy to grab them but for the 2nd time in a row when I grab a walker, guess where my off hand goes? WAYYYYYYYYYY off screen. My arm gets everal feet longer and I can't do anything but sit there and die. This has been done twice now and when I was doing the intro mission I was having just as hard issues to "grab then shoot" because after I grabbed my controllers would go hairwire and just stay in place. They would rotate but won't move.

Something is wrong with that and when you are trying to stab walkers and the game gliches like that, its not fun. Also the use of arms in VR rarely work, my arms would kept flinging around when I'm trying to get a stab in.

The game needs some serious patching for melee combat and how colisions work for the VR arms.

The game has a lot of potential if the devs would change a few things. In my opinion, it would be very nice if you can use your second hand for more than just collecting things and triggering a reload animation... I mean in nearly every game which has weapons you can reload like in real life, why not in this game? All in all the guns are kinda useless, I mean they have like no damage... 3 headshots for a kill? Come on, they feel like toy guns. The next thing is the level design... There's only one way, I expected an open world like gameplay or at least different ways to go through but the current solution is a bit boring. The physics are okay but there are way too few things you can interact with, the world around you is very detailed and looks nice, but then you realize the only thing you can do is walk around and kill those zombies... That's a bit disappointing and I think (especially if you play VR) it should feel as realistic as possible. There are also still a few glitches/bugs (especially with the enemies) but nothing special. These were my first impressions, thanks for reading. To sum up I hope that there will be some changes and updates in the future.

This is a quick review because i cant be bothered making a long review. In my opinion this game is good, but can be made better very easily. Good things are: the amount of zombies, little side mission things, a bit of gore (i havent unlocked katana yet), you can easily grab and toss around zombies and a bunch of others. Bad things adre: mainly the amount of buggy things, when you stab someone the blade can a lot of the time slip and just slightly cut the zombie making it annoying, the scavenges after a while can get repetitive, i also dont know why guns are weak but the shotgun is really weak for some reason.
Finally, to all the people out there this game isnt a lot like saint and sinners at all and its definitely a step up.

Alright so, first off wanted to say its a very good game, fun to play, story missions are good, runs are really fun to play even though sometimes too short and not that dangerous, i absolutely love the fact that you did not add stamina into this, at least regarding the fighting, so we can actually prove how good in shape we are while knifing down walkers. Guns work very good too, shooting and hitting zombies is very satisfying, although the fact that the reload animation is basically a fixed animation once you even get close to the pistol with a magazin in the other hand kind of annoys me a bit.

Now, the one thing that really ruins half of the experience for me is a mistake a lot of VR Game devs make. It's switching up the Controls for left handed people. Yes, we are left handed, but were not weirdos. We still move with the left Stick and look around with the right stick, we just shoot guns and use melee weapons with our left hand. Please update this, i have barely fired 10 shots because i cant aim with my right hand. Other than that, the game is really fun and i would definetly recommend it.

Now I'm not gonna lie the game is not perfect. However, it's nothing that can't get fixed with updates. The base game is decent and fun if you don't take it to serious, it feels like a updated Arizona sunshine in my opinion. For a more serious and scary game I recommend saints and sinner's which is more well rounded in my opinion and is perfect in what it tries to be (I enjoyed sas) . However, if you are simply trying to have fun and slice through hoards of zombies with no stamina holding you back I recommend you pick this game up as it will only get better with updates.BUT MAKE HEADSHOTS ONE SHOT ;)

review_title: Game is AMAZING and very fun!
one_reviews_text: This game is crazy fun and taking on the relentless walker herds is what does it for me. There is just a couple of mechanics which could be fixed within 1 patch update, for example the reloading mechanic isnt great and 3 shots for 1 walker needs to be changed, but aside from that, definetly worth it!

review_title: great game but there is one BIG problem
one_reviews_text: so, the game is amazing but the only problem that i have is a BIG problem. everytime a walker grabs me, i can no longer move my hands to get the walker off me. the only thing i can do is rotate my hands which does nothing because i cant reach for ANYTHING. is there anyone who knows how to fix this problem?

Not the technical achievement SnS was. If you can look past its flaws, this game is just fun. I might even enjoy it more than SnS, though some seem to be expecting an SnS sequel. Whoever decided a walker should take more than 1 shot to the head is a doofus. It doesn't fit lore and does nothing to help gameplay

Problem was me, nuf said ! Good game, but it does look kinda cartoonish ! No left right guns and why do you even have to grab one by the throat ? Good game ! Bizzare sh.. control wise ! I hated the tutorial, she kept saying it over and over ! No like here and talk about it and shhhh ! Hehehe
Yeah its alright :)
Saints and Sinners just has so much more to offer in terms of gameplay and story.
I'm sure the game is fine but the pre order pissed me off so that wont happen again
Slow play, story line is fair!
